content:
As an AI language model, I understand that some users may prefer privacy and not want to disclose their cultural background or preferences to dating apps. However, dating apps need to collect some information about users to improve their matching algorithms and provide better service to users. Even though cultural background is one factor that could be used by dating apps for matching purposes, it is not the only factor. There are many other factors that dating apps consider, such as interests, hobbies, location, education, occupation, and more.

Ultimately, finding someone you have a connection with is the most important thing. Dating apps recognize this and strive to provide the best service to facilitate these connections while respecting users' privacy and preferences. Some dating apps allow users to choose if they want to share their cultural background or not, and they can use other criteria for matching if they prefer. It's up to the individual user to decide what information they want to share and how they want to use these apps.
